DOC.brief_summary: This study will compare the effect of two topical non-steroidal antiinflammatory agents to control pain after photorefractive keratectomy (PRK) eye surgery.
DOC.brief_title: Bromday Versus Nevanac Eye Drops to Control Pain Following Photorefractive Keratectomy
DOC.criteria: male or female at least 18 years of age, no other ocular studies with 15 days prior to dosing, BCVA 20/200 or better, return for study visits and follow instructions from investigator and staff, self administer test article Ocular inflammation, hypersensitivity to bromfenac or nepafenac, any corneal pathology, have had radial keratotomy, corneal transplant or corneal refractive surgery in the last two years
